Node.definition: marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
literally: head; hence: = the topmost part of a vertically oriented object, such as a mountain, and the principal part of an horizontally oriented object, such as a street or a bed
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
literally: house (of an object); hence: = a place that is associated with a certain class people that live there, or objects that are found there
= state in which humans, deities or animals place themselves in a certain location in an upright position
literally: hand; hence: = pertaining to the location to the left or right of an object ◄ analogous to the location of someone's hands or arms
= the entrance to a town
= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall; ≈ poetic term
= a place by which one can enter an area with limited access points, such as a city, a temple courtyard, a palace courtyard, or the sea.
= the opening by which a person enters or exits an enclosed space, such as a house, a tent, a temple, or a larger area like a city; it can also be used figuratively to denote the mouth
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

= state in which someone is able to manipulate difficult circumstances in such a way that the outcome is favorable to the planner; ≈ sometimes used in a positive sense, but also used in a negative sense
= person who is easily influenced by other people, ideas or one's own passions; ◄ because of his/her lack of wisdom and experience

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
literally: heart; hence: = the ability to think for oneself as opposed to being easily swayed by what others say or do
literally: noble things; hence: = state in which words are spoken with authority

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: opening of lips; hence: = action by which humans speak
literally: smoothness; hence: = state in which an event is morally and ethically right
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
= action by which humans utter words with the focus on what is said
= mouth cavity; ◄ part of human body; ► plays an important role in actions like speaking, blowing, kissing, biting, tasting, and chewing
= state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= process of being done with the intention to outwit, trick, or deceive other people; ≈ can have both a positive and a negative sense
literally: to be crooked (of an event); hence: = state in which an event is considered morally and/or ethically unacceptable

Node.gloss: to be intelligent|to be discerning|to have insight|to be an expert
Node.definition: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= state in which an event is morally and ethically right
literally: to find (a certain condition); hence: = process by which humans eventually reach a certain state or condition
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth and quality
= state in which an object has been selected for its superior quality
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= a precious stone consisting of corundum in colour varieties varying from deep crimson or purple to pale rose; ≈ regarded as beautiful and valuable
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

= state in which someone is able to manipulate difficult circumstances in such a way that the outcome is favorable to the planner; ≈ sometimes used in a positive sense, but also used in a negative sense
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= human power or ability to devise a plan or strategy to accomplish a certain goal
literally: to find (a certain condition); hence: = process by which humans eventually reach a certain state or condition
= state in which humans experience fear
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong
= state in which humans have an elevated status in their own eyes, ≈ which is seen as a negative and undesirable attitude for humans
= state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong
= an action by which humans and deities utter words, ◄ as coming from their mouths
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= the ability to accomplish great things because of characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

Node.gloss: to reign|to be king|to be queen|to become king|to become queen
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are in a position of royal authority over a group of people
used in poetry only; = ruler of a nation or people
= causative action by which humans prescribe patterns of behavior required from other humans under their authority

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= state in which humans are in a position of authority over a group of people
= member of the nobility; ≈ associated with authority; expected to be generous, reliable, and just

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
literally: to find (a certain condition); hence: = process by which humans eventually reach a certain state or condition
= state in which humans possess an abundance of valuable goods, ≈ which is usually associated with a high status and considered a blessing from God
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live
= wealth that endures

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= the resulting effect of one's act or speech or decision
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth and quality
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= state in which an object has been selected for its superior quality
= a pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= practices that conform to the laws of God

Node.gloss: to give in possession|to will (one's) property
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities give land and other possessions to (other) humans as their permanent possession, with equal focus on the recipients and on the object that is being divided
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= place(s) where one's valuable goods are store
= causative action by which someone causes a certain location, container, or surface to be filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which deities call humans or objects into existence
= point in time at which an event starts happening
literally: road; hence: = a journey made for a specific purpose, usually on someone else’s behalf
= an activity performed by a deity
= referent pointing to a period or point of time in the distant past
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
literally: to pour out; hence: = causative action by which a deity creates something that did not exist before, ◄ as if by pouring out a substance in a mold
literally: head; hence: = the point in time at which an event starts happening

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

= great body of water located around and under the surface of the earth; when the world was newly created this water used to cover the earth as well; the subterranean water comes up to the surface of the earth through springs
= process by which humans and animals bring forth new offspring

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= an opening in the earth that gives access to the subterranean water which either comes to the surface or can be drawn from it; ≈ its water is regarded as a source of blessing
= state in which an object contains a large quantity of a substance
= a marker pointing to the time preceding a particular point in time
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= process by which someone or something is caused to move into a space of restricted movement
= an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a mountain (הַר)
= process by which humans and animals bring forth new offspring
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= area outside of town; ► used for farming
literally: head; hence: = the point in time at which an event starts happening
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface
primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an object to be firmly located in a certain place

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

Node.gloss: to carve|to portray|to draw|to mark out|to write
Node.definition: = action by which humans reproduce the form or shape of an object on another object; ◄ by carving, drawing, writing, etc.; ► for the purpose of decoration, communication, sometimes as preparation for a new construction

= dome shaped structure; used exclusively to denote the firmament, which separates the waters above the earth from the earth itself; ≈ God is said to have his dwelling place above this structure; it is also regarded as the boundary between light and darkness

= great body of water located around and under the surface of the earth; when the world was newly created this water used to cover the earth as well; the subterranean water comes up to the surface of the earth through springs

Node.gloss: to strengthen|to support|to repair|to let grow strong
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause inanimate objects or (other) humans to have physical, political, and/or military strength

Node.gloss: to be powerful|to be strong|to prevail|to give strength|to make powerful
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities have the ability to exert force|= causative action by which deities or events give humans or inanimate objects the ability to exert force
= hole in the earth that gives access to the subterranean water which either comes to the surface or can be drawn from it

= great body of water located around and under the surface of the earth; when the world was newly created this water used to cover the earth as well; the subterranean water comes up to the surface of the earth through springs
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= point in space that may not or cannot be crossed
= an action by which humans and deities utter words, ◄ as coming from their mouths

Node.gloss: to carve|to portray|to draw|to mark out|to write
Node.definition: = action by which humans reproduce the form or shape of an object on another object; ◄ by carving, drawing, writing, etc.; ► for the purpose of decoration, communication, sometimes as preparation for a new construction
= the bottom part of a construction, which bears everything built on top of it; sometimes used in a somewhat figurative sense to denote the foundations of heaven and earth

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
relational indicating a location in the direct vicinity of the point of reference
= person with skills for a specific craft

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= action by which humans engage in activities associated with joy and contentment by leaping, dancing, celebrating, and even engaging in games
literally: at all time; = a long stretch of time, without any interruptions
= action by which humans engage in activities associated with joy and contentment by leaping, dancing, celebrating, and even engaging in games
primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener
= title used to address a person (male if in singular) who is regarded with some degree of affection, ◄ as if he were the speaker's child
= state of being considered fortunate and blessed by God; ≈ accompanied by an attitude of admiration
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= action by which humans or deities act in accordance with a certain (usually) prescribed pattern of behavior, such as a law, covenant, etc.

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

Node.gloss: to be able|to be skillful|to be wise|to be intelligent
Node.definition: = state or process by which humans, deities, and animals possess or gain a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= state of being considered fortunate and blessed by God; ≈ accompanied by an attitude of admiration
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= a hinged barrier at the entrance to a town, building, or room; ◄ usually made out of wood, but occasionally also out of metal; ► provides or prevents access; ≈ sometimes associated with vulnerability

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time
literally: doorposts of the doorway; hence: = entrance to a building
= the opening by which a person enters or exits an enclosed space, such as a house, a tent, a temple, or a larger area like a city; it can also be used figuratively to denote the mouth
literally: to find (a certain condition); hence: = process by which humans eventually reach a certain state or condition
literally: to find (a certain condition); hence: = process by which humans eventually reach a certain state or condition

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= to attain a particular state or position
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which a human being is unable to succeed in what s/he intend to do
= action by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans with which they have a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich themselves in one way or another

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= process by which humans or animals stop living
